result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Darrell Pickens Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ronald Darrell Pickens not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. SPD has not appointed an Attorney.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Branch PE.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronald Darrell Pickens not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. SPD has not appointed new counsel as previous counsel was withdrawn on August 12, 2022 due to a conflict of interest. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court, defendant Ronald Darrell Pickens not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense motion to withdraw due to conflict of interest. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel hearing.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ronald Darrell Pickens in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Ronald Darrell Pickens in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 5.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
